intro: Callianthemum taipaicum, commonly known as the Taiwan stonecress, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
